situation.title: Universities
situation.meta_description: In-person attendance of university students in schools is banned.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

In-person attendance of university students in schools is banned.

Attendance at exams with more than 10 people at a time is also banned. The exception from this rule applies to examinations in medical professions.

Practical education is also banned. The exemption from this ban applies to clinical and practical education in medical fields and practical experience in educational and teaching fields in preschool, elementary and secondary schools.

It is important to monitor the decisions and the latest information released by your specific school since the schools make their own decisions in this regard. The school website and academic department are a good source of information. Besides the academic department, you can also consult the academic senate.

questions_answers.question: Can exams happen in person?
questions_answers.value: Yes, if there are less than 10 people. Where possible, distance examinations should be preferred.

questions_answers.question: Can examinations related to practicing medical professions take place?
Does the examiner count as one of the ten people allowed during an exam?
Is the bar exam allowed to take place?
questions_answers.value: No, the Czech Bar Association decided that the exams would not take place (https://www.cak.cz/scripts/detail.php?id=23550). Other chambers can make similar decisions.
